snippet: “There Is Someone” is a show that has attracted a huge following with the sort of talk that is popular with young men everywhere, but censors and religious groups are not laughing.
abstract: Baghdad Journal; There Is Someone is a popular comedy television show that has attracted a huge following among young men in Iraq; show, which includes candid jokes about sex and relationships, lays bare the deep schisms in Iraqi society over the limits of Western-style notions of free speech; jokes have not gone over well with government censors and religious groups. Photos (M)

byline.original: By TIM ARANGO; Yasir Ghazi contributed reporting

lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD -- The concept of the television program was subversive by Iraqi standards: a comedy daring enough to joke about sex and relationships. ''The idea we had for this show was just a bunch of us guys sitting around drinking and telling jokes,'' said Gazwan Shawi, a producer, who wore black wraparound sunglasses and a gold chain, and greeted a guest with an elaborate handshake in the style used by rappers.

headline.main: Sitting Around, Having a Drink, Joking About Sex. On Iraqi TV.
